member.name: M:Cake.Common.Diagnostics.LoggingAliases.Error(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an error message to the log using the specified format information.

example.code: Error("Hello {0}! Today is an {1:dddd}", "World", DateTime.Now);

member.summary: Writes an error message to the log using the specified log message action. Evaluation message only if verbosity same or more verbose.
member.param: The function called for message when logging.

example.code: Error(logAction=>logAction("Hello {0}! Today is an {1:dddd}", "World", DateTime.Now));

member.summary: Provides functionality to perform simple text transformations from a Cake build script and save them to disc.

member.summary: Gets the text transformation template.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Saves the text transformation to a file.

member.summary: Returns a string containing the rendered template.
member.returns: A string containing the rendered template.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Text.TextTransformationAliases
member.summary: Contains functionality related to text transformation.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Text.TextTransformationAliases.TransformText(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a text transformation from the provided template.
member.example:
This sample shows how to create a using the specified template.
string text = TransformText("Hello <%subject%>!") .WithToken("subject", "world") .ToString();

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Text.TextTransformationAliases.TransformText(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a text transformation from the provided template, using the specified placeholder.
member.example:
This sample shows how to create a using the specified template and placeholder.
string text = TransformText("Hello {subject}!", "{", "}") .WithToken("subject", "world") .ToString();

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Text.TextTransformationAliases.TransformTextFile(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Creates a text transformation from the provided template on disc.
member.example:
This sample shows how to create a using the specified template file with the placeholder format <%key%>.
string text = TransformTextFile("./template.txt") .WithToken("subject", "world") .ToString();

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Text.TextTransformationAliases.TransformTextFile(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a text transformation from the provided template on disc, using the specified placeholder.
member.example:
This sample shows how to create a using the specified template file and placeholder.
string text = TransformTextFile("./template.txt", "{", "}") .WithToken("subject", "world") .ToString();

summary.para: Contains functionality related to ILMerge.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=ilmerge"

summary.para: Contains functionality related to MSBuild.
In order to use the commands for this alias, MSBuild will already have to be installed on the machine the Cake Script is being executed.

member.summary: Builds the specified solution using MSBuild.

member.summary: Builds the specified solution using MSBuild.

example.code: MSBuild("./src/Cake.sln", configurator => configurator.SetConfiguration("Debug") .SetVerbosity(Verbosity.Minimal) .UseToolVersion(MSBuildToolVersion.VS2015) .SetMSBuildPlatform(MSBuildPlatform.x86) .SetPlatformTarget(PlatformTarget.MSIL));

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contain types used to interact with MSTest.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to running MSTest unit tests.

In order to use the commands for this alias, MSTest will need to be installed on the machine where the Cake script is being executed. This is typically achieved by having either Visual Studio installed, or by using the Micrsoft Build Tools, for example, for 2015.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestAliases.MSTest(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String)
member.summary: Runs all MSTest unit tests in the assemblies matching the specified pattern.

example.code: MSTest("./Tests/*.UnitTests.dll");

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestAliases.MSTest(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.String,Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestSettings)
member.summary: Runs all MSTest unit tests in the assemblies matching the specified pattern.

example.code: MSTest("./Tests/*.UnitTests.dll", new MSTestSettings() { NoIsolation = false });

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestAliases.MSTest(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Cake.Core.IO.FilePath})
member.summary: Runs all MSTest unit tests in the specified assemblies.

example.code: var paths = new List<FilePath>() { "./assemblydir1", "./assemblydir2" }; MSTest(paths);

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestAliases.MSTest(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Cake.Core.IO.FilePath},Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestSettings)
member.summary: Runs all MSTest unit tests in the specified assemblies.

example.code: var paths = new List<FilePath>() { "./assemblydir1", "./assemblydir2" }; MSTest(paths, new MSTestSettings() { NoIsolation = false });

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestSettings.NoIsolation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to run tests within the MSTest process. This choice improves test run speed but increases risk to the MSTest.exe process. Defaults to true.
member.value: true if running without isolation; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestSettings.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the test category filter string to pass to MSTest.exe flag /testcategory.

member.summary: Gets or sets the filepath for a named resulting test file. MSTest.exe flag /resultsfile.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.MSTest.MSTestSettings.TestSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the test settings file to pass to MSTest.exe flag /testsettings.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings
member.summary: Contains settings used by .

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.OutputDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory in which packages will be installed. If none is specified, the current directory will be used.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of the package to install. If none specified, the latest will be used.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.ExcludeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to exclude the version number from the package folder.
member.value: true if to exclude the version number from the package folder; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.Prerelease
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow installation of prerelease packages. This flag is not required when restoring packages by installing from packages.config.
member.value: true to allow installation of prerelease packages; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.RequireConsent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to check if package install consent is granted before installing a package.
member.value: true if to check if package install consent is granted before installing a package; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.SolutionDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the solution directory path for package restore.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of packages sources to use for this command.
member.value: The list of packages sources to use for this command.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.NoCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to use the machine cache as the first package source.
member.value: true to not use the machine cache as the first package source; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.DisableParallelProcessing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to disable parallel processing of packages for this command. Disable parallel processing of packages for this command.
member.value: true to disable parallel processing of packages for this command; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.Verbosity
member.summary: Gets or sets the output verbosity.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.ConfigFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the NuGet configuration file. If not specified, the file %AppData%\NuGet\NuGet.config is used as the configuration file.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Install.NuGetInstallSettings.FallbackSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of packages sources to use as fallbacks for this command. This setting requires NuGet V3 or later.
member.value: The list of packages sources to use as fallbacks for this command.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuSpecContent
member.summary: Represents a NuGet nuspec file

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuSpecContent.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the file or files to include. The path is relative to the NuSpec file unless an absolute path is specified. The wildcard character - * - is allowed. Using a double wildcard - ** implies a recursive directory search.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuSpecContent.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative path to the directory within the package where the source files will be placed.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuSpecContent.Exclude
member.summary: Gets or sets the file or files to exclude. This is usually combined with a wildcard value in the src attribute. The exclude attribute can contain a semi-colon delimited list of files or a file pattern. Using a double wildcard - ** - implies a recursive exclude pattern.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuSpecDependency
member.summary: Represents a NuGet nuspec dependency

member.summary: Gets or sets the dependency's version.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.NuGetAliases
member.summary: Contains functionality for working with NuGet.
member.para: Since Cake requires NuGet to be available very early in the build pipeline, we recommend that NuGet is made available via the Cake BootStrapper.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.NuGetAliases.NuGetPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuGetPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a NuGet package using the specified Nuspec or project file.
member.param: The nuspec or project file path.

example.code:
var nuGetPackSettings = new NuGetPackSettings { Id = "TestNuget", Version = "0.0.0.1", Title = "The tile of the package", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Description = "The description of the package", Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/"), IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/master/icons/testnuget.png"), LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), Copyright = "Some company 2015", ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, Symbols = false, NoPackageAnalysis = true, Files = new [] { new NuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestNuget.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, BasePath = "./src/TestNuget/bin/release", OutputDirectory = "./nuget" };
NuGetPack("./nuspec/TestNuget.nuspec", nuGetPackSettings);

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.NuGetAliases.NuGetPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Cake.Core.IO.FilePath},Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuGetPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates NuGet packages using the specified Nuspec or project files.
member.param: The nuspec or project file paths.

example.code:
var nuGetPackSettings = new NuGetPackSettings { Id = "TestNuget", Version = "0.0.0.1", Title = "The tile of the package", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Description = "The description of the package", Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/"), IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/master/icons/testnuget.png"), LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), Copyright = "Some company 2015", ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, Symbols = false, NoPackageAnalysis = true, Files = new [] { new NuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestNuget.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, BasePath = "./src/TestNuget/bin/release", OutputDirectory = "./nuget" };
var nuspecFiles = GetFiles("./**/*.nuspec"); NuGetPack(nuspecFiles, nuGetPackSettings);

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.NuGetAliases.NuGetPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Common.Tools.NuGet.Pack.NuGetPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a NuGet package using the specified settings.

example.code:
var nuGetPackSettings = new NuGetPackSettings { Id = "TestNuget", Version = "0.0.0.1", Title = "The tile of the package", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Description = "The description of the package", Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/"), IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/master/icons/testnuget.png"), LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestNuget/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), Copyright = "Some company 2015", ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, Symbols = false, NoPackageAnalysis = true, Files = new [] { new NuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestNuget.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, BasePath = "./src/TestNuget/bin/release", OutputDirectory = "./nuget" };
NuGetPack(nuGetPackSettings);

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace contain types used to interact with NUnit.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to running NUnit v2 and v3 unit tests.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=NUnit.ConsoleRunner"

member.summary: Runs all NUnit unit tests in the assemblies matching the specified pattern.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage
member.summary: The /domain option controls of the creation of AppDomains for running tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.Default
member.summary: Create a separate AppDomain for each assembly if more than one is listed on the command line, otherwise creates a single AppDomain.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.None
member.summary: No AppDomain is created - the tests are run in the primary domain. This normally requires copying the NUnit assemblies into the same directory as your tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.Single
member.summary: A single test AppDomain is created for all test assemblies This is how NUnit worked prior to version 2.4.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3AppDomainUsage.Multiple
member.summary: An AppDomain is created for each assembly specified on the command line.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Labels
member.summary: Represents the possible values for the Labels option.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Labels.Off
member.summary: Does not output labels. This is the default.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Labels.On
member.summary: Outputs labels for tests that are run.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Labels.All
member.summary: Outputs labels for all tests.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption
member.summary: Represents the various ways NUnit loads tests in processes.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption.Multiple
member.summary: A separate process is created for each test assembly. This is the default.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption.Separate
member.summary: One separate process is created to run all of the test assemblies.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3ProcessOption.InProcess
member.summary: All the tests are run in the nunit-console process.

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings
member.summary: Contains settings used by .

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Test
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of tests to run or explore.
member.value: A comma-separated list of test names.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.TestList
member.summary: Gets or sets a file containing the tests to run.
member.value: File path containing a list of tests to run, one per line.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Where
member.summary: Gets or sets the test selection expression indicating what tests will be run.
member.value: The --where option is intended to extend or replace the earlier --test, --include and --exclude options by use of a selection expression describing exactly which tests to use. Examples of usage are: --where:cat==Data --where "method =~ /DataTest*/ && cat = Slow"

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the default timeout to be used for test cases in this run. If any test exceeds the timeout value, it is cancelled and reported as an error.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Seed
member.summary: Gets or sets the random seed used to generate test cases.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Workers
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of worker threads to be used in running tests.If not specified, defaults to 2 or the number of processors, whichever is greater.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.StopOnError
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether execution of the test run should terminate immediately on the first test failure or error.
member.value: true if execution of the test run should terminate immediately on the first test failure or error; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Work
member.summary: Gets or sets the directory to use for output files. If not specified, defaults to the current directory.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.OutputFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the location that NUnit should write test output.
member.value: The location that NUnit should write test output.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.ErrorOutputFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the location that NUnit should write test error output.
member.value: The location that NUnit should write test error output.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Full
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to print full report of all test results.
member.value: true if a full report of test results should be printed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.Results
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the XML result file.
member.value: The name of the XML result file. Defaults to TestResult.xml.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.ResultFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format that the results should be in. Results must be set to have any effect. Specify nunit2 to output the results in NUnit 2 xml format. nunit3 may be specified for NUnit 3 format, however this is the default. Additional formats may be supported in the future, check the NUnit documentation.
member.value: The format of the result file. Defaults to nunit3.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnit3Settings.ResultTransform

summary.para: Contains functionality related to running NUnit tests.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=NUnit.Runners&version=2.6.4"

example.code: NUnit("./src/UnitTests/*.dll");

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitAppDomainUsage
member.summary: The /domain option controls of the creation of AppDomains for running tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitAppDomainUsage.Default
member.summary: Create a separate AppDomain for each assembly listed on the command line.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitAppDomainUsage.None
member.summary: No domain is created - the tests are run in the primary domain. This normally requires copying the NUnit assemblies into the same directory as your tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitAppDomainUsage.Single
member.summary: A test domain is created - this is how NUnit worked prior to version 2.4

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitProcessOption
member.summary: Represents the various ways NUnit loads tests in processes.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitProcessOption.Single
member.summary: All the tests are run in the nunit-console process. This is the default.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitProcessOption.Separate
member.summary: A separate process is created to run the tests.

member.name: F:Cake.Common.Tools.NUnit.NUnitProcessOption.Multiple
member.summary: A separate process is created for each test assembly.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the release number to use for the new release.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.DefaultPackageVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the default version number of all packages to use the new release.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.Packages
member.summary: Gets or sets the version number to use for a package in the release.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.PackagesFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder containing NuGet packages.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.ReleaseNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets the release notes for the new release.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.ReleaseNotesFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to a file that contains Release Notes for the new release.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.IgnoreExisting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to Ignore Existing release flag.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.DeployTo
member.summary: Gets or sets environment to automatically deploy to, e.g., Production.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.ShowProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether progress of the deployment should be followed. (Sets --waitfordeployment and --norawlog to true.)

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.ForcePackageDownload
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force downloading of already installed packages. Default false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.WaitForDeployment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to wait synchronously for deployment to finish.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.DeploymentTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum time (timespan format) that the console session will wait for the deployment to finish (default 00:10:00). This will not stop the deployment. Requires WaitForDeployment parameter set.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.CancelOnTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to cancel the deployment if the deployment timeout is reached(default false).

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.DeploymentChecksLeepCycle
member.summary: Gets or sets how much time should elapse between deployment status checks(default 00:00:10).

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.GuidedFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use Guided Failure mode. If not specified, will use default setting from environment.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.SpecificMachines
member.summary: Gets or sets list of machines names to target in the deployed environment.If not specified all machines in the environment will be considered.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.Force
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a project is configured to skip packages with already-installed versions, override this setting to force re-deployment (flag, default false).

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.SkipSteps
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of steps to be skipped. Takes step names.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.NoRawLog
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether print the raw log of failed tasks or not.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.RawLogFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a file where to redirect the raw log of failed tasks.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.Variables
member.summary: Gets or sets values for any prompted variables.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.DeployAt
member.summary: Gets or sets time at which deployment should start (scheduled deployment), specified as any valid DateTimeOffset format, and assuming the time zone is the current local time zone.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.Tenant
member.summary: Gets or sets a tenant the deployment will be performed for; specify this argument multiple times to add multiple tenants or use `*` wildcard to deploy to tenants able to deploy.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.TenantTags
member.summary: Gets or sets a tenant tags used to match tenants that the deployment will be performed for; specify this argument multiple times to add multiple tenant tags.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.Channel
member.summary: Gets or sets the octopus channel for the new release.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.IgnoreChannelRules
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether octopus channel rules should be ignored.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.OctopusDeploy.CreateReleaseSettings.DeploymentProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether progress of the deployment will be shown.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to RoundhousE.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=roundhouse"

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.CommandTimeout

member.value: This is the timeout when commands are run. This is not for admin commands or restore.

member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout (in seconds) for admin connections.

member.summary: Gets or sets the version file.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.VersionXPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the XPath to locate version in the .
member.value: Works in conjunction with an XML version file.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.AlterDatabaseFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'alterDatabase' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your alter database scripts. Read up on token replacement. You will want to use {{DatabaseName}} here instead of specifying a database name.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RunAfterCreateDatabaseFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'runAfterCreateDatabase' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you will keep scripts that ONLY run after a database is created.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RunBeforeUpFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'runBeforeUp' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep scripts that you want to run before your update scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.UpFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'up' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your update scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RunFirstAfterUpFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'runFirstAfterUp' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep any functions, views, or sprocs that are order dependent. If you have a function that depends on a view, you definitely need the view in this folder.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.FunctionsFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'functions' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your functions.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.ViewsFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'views' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your views.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.SprocsFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'sprocs' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your stored procedures.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.IndexesFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'indexes' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your indexes.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RunAfterOtherAnyTimeScriptsFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'runAfterOtherAnyTimeScripts' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep scripts that will be run after all of the other any time scripts complete.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.PermissionsFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'permissions' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder where you keep your permissions scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.BeforeMigrationFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'beforeMig' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder for scripts to run before migration and outside of a transaction.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.AfterMigrationFolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder name for 'afterMig' scripts.
member.value: The name of the folder for scripts to run before migration and outside of a transaction.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.SchemaName
member.summary: Gets or sets the schema name to use instead of [RoundhousE].
member.value: The schema where RH stores its tables.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Environment
member.summary: Gets or sets the environment for RH to be scoped.
member.value: This allows RH to be environment aware and only run scripts that are in a particular environment based on the namingof the script. LOCAL.something**.ENV.**sql would only be run in the LOCAL environment.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Restore
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether perform a restore.
member.value: This instructs RH to do a restore (with the parameter) of a database before running migration scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RestoreFilePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the restore file path.
member.value: File path of back when Restore is set to true

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.CreateDatabaseCustomScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom database creation script.
member.value: This instructs RH to use this script for creating a database instead of the default based on the SQLType.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.OutputPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the output path.
member.value: Path to where migration artifacts are stored.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.WarnOnOneTimeScriptChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to warn when previously run scripts have changed.
member.value: Instructs RH to execute changed one time scripts (DDL/DML in 'Up'/) that have previously been run against the database instead of failing. A warning is logged for each one time scripts that is rerun.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Silent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to keep RH silent.
member.value: Tells RH not to ask for any input when it runs.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DatabaseType
member.summary: Gets or sets database type.
member.value: Database Type (fully qualified class name implementing [roundhouse.sql.Database, roundhouse])

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Drop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to drop the DB.
member.value: This instructs RH to remove a database and not run migration scripts.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.WithTransaction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use transactions.
member.value: This instructs RH to run inside of a transaction.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RecoveryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets SQL Server recovery mode.
member.value: This sets the recovery model for SQL Server during migration. (NoChange, Simple, Full)

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DryRun
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to perform a dry run.
member.value: This instructs RH to log what would have run, but not to actually run anything against the database. Use this option if you are trying to figure out what RH is going to do.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DoNotCreateDatabase
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create a database if it does not exist.
member.value: This instructs RH to not create a database if it does not exists. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DisableOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to disable output of backup, items ran, permissions dumps, etc.
member.value: Disable output of backups, items ran, permissions dumps, etc. Log files are kept. Useful for example in CI environment. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Baseline
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create an insert for its recording tables, but not run anything.
member.value: This instructs RH to create an insert for its recording tables, but not to actually run anything against the database. Use this option if you already have scripts that have been run through other means. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.Debug
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to write debug messages.
member.value: This instructs RH to write out all messages. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.RunAllAnyTimeScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to execute any time scripts.
member.value: This instructs RH to run any time scripts every time it is run. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.DisableTokenReplacement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to perform token replacement.
member.value: This instructs RH to not perform token replacement {{somename}}. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Roundhouse.RoundhouseSettings.SearchAllSubdirectoriesInsteadOfTraverse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to search all subdirectories.
member.value: Each Migration folder's subdirectories are traversed by default. This option pulls back scripts from the main directory and all subdirectories at once. Defaults to false.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to XBuild.
In order to use the commands for this alias, XBuild (which is part of Mono) will already have to be installed on the machine the Cake Script is being executed.

example.code: XBuild("./src/Cake.sln");

member.summary: Builds the specified solution using XBuild.

example.code: XBuild("./src/Cake.sln", configurator => configurator.SetConfiguration("Debug") .SetVerbosity(Verbosity.Minimal) .UseToolVersion(XBuildToolVersion.NET40));

summary.para: Contains functionality related to running xunit tests.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=xunit.runner.console"

example.code: XUnit2("./src/**/bin/Release/*.Tests.dll");

member.summary: Gets the traits to include.
member.remarks: Only run tests with matching name/value traits. If more than one is specified, it acts as an OR operation.

member.summary: Gets the traits to exclude.
member.remarks: Do not run tests with matching name/value traits. If more than one is specified, it acts as an AND operation.

summary.para: Contains functionality for working with Chocolatey.
In order to use the commands for this alias, Chocolatey will require to be installed on the machine where the build script is being run. See this page for details on how Chocolatey can be installed.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.ChocolateyAliases.ChocolateyPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.Pack.ChocolateyPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a Chocolatey package using the specified Nuspec file.

example.code:
var chocolateyPackSettings = new ChocolateyPackSettings { Id = "TestChocolatey", Title = "The tile of the package", Version = "0.0.0.1", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", Description = "The description of the package", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), PackageSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), ProjectSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), DocsUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), MailingListUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), BugTrackerUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, Copyright = "Some company 2015", LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/master/icons/testchocolatey.png"), ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Files = new [] { new ChocolateyNuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestChocolatey.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, Debug = false, Verbose = false, Force = false, Noop = false, LimitOutput = false, ExecutionTimeout = 13, CacheLocation = @"C:\temp", AllowUnofficial = false };
ChocolateyPack("./nuspec/TestChocolatey.nuspec", chocolateyPackSettings);

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.ChocolateyAliases.ChocolateyPack(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.Pack.ChocolateyPackSettings)
member.summary: Creates a Chocolatey package using the specified settings.

example.code:
var chocolateyPackSettings = new ChocolateyPackSettings { Id = "TestChocolatey", Title = "The tile of the package", Version = "0.0.0.1", Authors = new[] {"John Doe"}, Owners = new[] {"Contoso"}, Summary = "Excellent summary of what the package does", Description = "The description of the package", ProjectUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), PackageSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), ProjectSourceUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), DocsUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), MailingListUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), BugTrackerUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/"), Tags = new [] {"Cake", "Script", "Build"}, Copyright = "Some company 2015", LicenseUrl = new Uri("https://github.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/blob/master/LICENSE.md"), RequireLicenseAcceptance= false, IconUrl = new Uri("http://cdn.rawgit.com/SomeUser/TestChocolatey/master/icons/testchocolatey.png"), ReleaseNotes = new [] {"Bug fixes", "Issue fixes", "Typos"}, Files = new [] { new ChocolateyNuSpecContent {Source = "bin/TestChocolatey.dll", Target = "bin"}, }, Debug = false, Verbose = false, Force = false, Noop = false, LimitOutput = false, ExecutionTimeout = 13, CacheLocation = @"C:\temp", AllowUnofficial = false };
ChocolateyPack(chocolateyPackSettings);

member.param: The id of the package to install.

example.code: ChocolateyInstall("MyChocolateyPackage", new ChocolateyInstallSettings { Source = true, Version = "1.2.3", Prerelease = false, Forcex86 = false, InstallArguments = "arg1", OverrideArguments = false, NotSilent = false, PackageParameters = "param1", AllowDowngrade = false, SideBySide = false, IgnoreDependencies = false, ForceDependencies = false, SkipPowerShell = false, User = "user", Password = "password", IgnoreChecksums = false, Debug = false, Verbose = false, Force = false, Noop = false, LimitOutput = false, ExecutionTimeout = 13, CacheLocation = @"C:\temp", AllowUnofficial = false });

member.summary: Represents a Chocolatey nuspec file

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.Pack.ChocolateyNuSpecContent.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the file or files to include. The path is relative to the NuSpec file unless an absolute path is specified. The wildcard character - * - is allowed. Using a double wildcard - ** implies a recursive directory search.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.Pack.ChocolateyNuSpecContent.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative path to the directory within the package where the source files will be placed.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.Chocolatey.Pack.ChocolateyNuSpecContent.Exclude
member.summary: Gets or sets the file or files to exclude. This is usually combined with a wildcard value in the src attribute. The exclude attribute can contain a semi-colon delimited list of files or a file pattern. Using a double wildcard - ** - implies a recursive exclude pattern.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to DotCover.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the appropriate settings class:
#tool "nuget:?package=JetBrains.dotCover.CommandLineTools"

member.summary: Gets the coverage filters using the following syntax: +:module=*;class=*;function=*; Use -:myassembly to exclude an assembly from code coverage. Asterisk wildcard (*) is supported here. This represents the /Filters option.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.DotCover.DotCoverCoverageSettings.AttributeFilters
member.summary: Gets the attribute filters using the following syntax: filter1;filter2;... Asterisk wildcard(*) is supported here This represents the /AttributeFilters option.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.DotCover.DotCoverCoverageSettings.DisableDefaultFilters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the default (automatically added) filters should be disabled This represents the /DisableDefaultFilters option.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to .NET Core CLI.
In order to use the commands for this alias, the .Net Core CLI tools will need to be installed on the machine where the Cake script is being executed. See this page for information on how to install.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to ReSharper's dupFinder tool.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=JetBrains.ReSharper.CommandLineTools"

member.summary: Analyses the specified file with ReSharper's DupFinder. The file can either be a solution/project or a source file.

example.code: DupFinder("./src/MySolution.sln");

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.DupFinder.DupFinderAliases.DupFinder(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.DupFinder.DupFinderSettings)

member.summary: Analyses the specified projects with ReSharper's DupFinder. The files can either be solutions and projects or a source files.

example.code: var projects = GetFiles("./src/**/*.csproj"); DupFinder(projects);

member.summary: Analyses the specified projects with ReSharper's DupFinder using the specified settings. The files can either be solutions and projects or a source files.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to GitReleaseNotes.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=GitReleaseNotes"

member.summary: Generates a set of release notes based on the commit history of the repository and specified settings.

example.code: GitReleaseNotes("c:/temp/releasenotes.md", new GitReleaseNotesSettings { WorkingDirectory = "c:/temp", Verbose = true, IssueTracker = IssueTracker.GitHub, AllTags = true, RepoUserName = "bob", RepoPassword = "password", RepoUrl = "http://myrepo.co.uk", RepoBranch = "master", IssueTrackerUrl = "http://myissuetracker.co.uk", IssueTrackerUserName = "bob", IssueTrackerPassword = "password", IssueTrackerProjectId = "1234", Categories = "Category1", Version = "1.2.3.4", AllLabels = true });

member.summary: Uses Jira as Issue Tracker.

#tool "nuget:?package=ILRepack"

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to copy assembly attributes (by default only the primary assembly attributes are copied)
member.value: true if assembly attributes should be copied; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the assembly file to take attributes from
member.value: The assembly file to take attributes from.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.AllowMultiple
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow multiple attributes (if type allows)
member.value: true if multiple attributes should be allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.TargetKind
member.summary: Gets or sets the specify target assembly kind (library, exe, winexe supported, default is same as first assembly)
member.value: The kind of the target assembly to create.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.TargetPlatform
member.summary: Gets or sets the target platform (v1, v1.1, v2, v4 supported)

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.XmlDocs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to merge XML documentation as well
member.value: true if xml documents should be merged; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.Libs
member.summary: Gets or sets the paths to search directories for referenced assemblies (can be specified multiple times)

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.Internalize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to set all types but the ones from the first assembly 'internal'
member.value: true if types in assemblies other than the primary assembly should have their visibility modified to internal; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.DelaySign
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to set the key, but don't sign the assembly
member.value: true if assembly should be delay signed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.AllowDup
member.summary: Gets or sets the specified type for being duplicated in input assemblies
member.value: The type to allow duplication of.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.AllowDuplicateResources
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to duplicate resources in output assembly (by default they're ignored)
member.value: true if duplicate resources should be allowed in the output assembly; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.ZeroPeKind
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow assemblies with Zero PeKind (but obviously only IL will get merged)
member.value: true if assemblies with Zero PeKind should be allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.Wildcards
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow (and resolve) file wildcards (e.g. `*`.dll) in input assemblies
member.value: true if file wildcards should be allowed in input assembly paths; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.Parallel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use as many CPUs as possible to merge the assemblies
member.value: true if merging should use as many CPUs as possible in parallel; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.Pause
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to pause execution once completed (good for debugging)
member.value: true if execution should pause once completed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.ILRepack.ILRepackSettings.Verbose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show more logs
member.value: true if more logs should be output during execution; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to Inno Setup.
In order to use the commands for this alias, Inno Setup will need to be installed on the machine where the Cake script is being executed. See this page for information on how to download/install.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to ReSharper's InspectCode tool.

#tool "nuget:?package=JetBrains.ReSharper.CommandLineTools"

summary.para: Contains functionality related to ReportUnit.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the class:
#tool "nuget:?package=ReportUnit"

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitAliases.ReportUnit(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.DirectoryPath)
member.summary: Converts the reports in the specified directory into human readable form.

example.para: Provide only an input folder, which will causes ReportUnit to search entire directory for report files.
example.code: ReportUnit("c:/temp");

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitAliases.ReportUnit(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.DirectoryPath,Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitSettings)
member.summary: Converts the reports in the specified directory into human readable form.

example.para: Provide an input folder and custom ToolPath, which will causes ReportUnit to search entire directory for report files.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitAliases.ReportUnit(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.DirectoryPath,Cake.Core.IO.DirectoryPath,Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitSettings)
member.summary: Converts the reports in the specified directory into human readable form and outputs to specified folder.

example.para: Provide both input and output folder, which will causes ReportUnit to search entire directory for report files, and output the results to specified location.
example.code: ReportUnit("c:/temp/input", "c:/temp/output");

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitAliases.ReportUnit(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Converts the single specified report into human readable form and outputs to specified file.

example.para: Provide both input and output file, which will causes ReportUnit to transform only the specific file, and output to the specified location.
example.code: ReportUnit("c:/temp/input", "c:/temp/output");

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitAliases.ReportUnit(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.ReportUnit.ReportUnitSettings)
member.summary: Converts the single specified report into human readable form and outputs to specified file.

example.para: Provide both input and output file, which will causes ReportUnit to transform only the specific file, and output to the specified location. Also use a custom path for the reportunit.exe.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to SpecFlow.

In order to use the commands for this alias, include the following in your build.cake file to download and install from NuGet.org, or specify the ToolPath within the appropriate settings class:
#tool "nuget:?package=SpecFlow"

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.SpecFlow.SpecFlowAliases.SpecFlowStepDefinitionReport(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Creates a report that shows the usage and binding status of the steps for the entire project. You can use this report to find both unused code in the automation layer and scenario steps that have no definition yet. See SpecFlow Documentation for more information.
member.param: The path of the project file containing the feature files.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.SpecFlow.SpecFlowAliases.SpecFlowStepDefinitionReport(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.SpecFlow.StepDefinitionReport.SpecFlowStepDefinitionReportSettings)
member.summary: Creates a report that shows the usage and binding status of the steps for the entire project. You can use this report to find both unused code in the automation layer and scenario steps that have no definition yet. See SpecFlow Documentation for more information.
member.param: The path of the project file containing the feature files.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.SpecFlow.SpecFlowAliases.SpecFlowTestExecutionReport(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.Action{Cake.Core.ICakeContext},Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Creates a formatted HTML report of a test execution. The report contains a summary about the executed tests and the result and also a detailed report for the individual scenario executions. See SpecFlow Documentation for more information.
member.param: The action to run SpecFlow for. Supported actions are: MSTest, NUnit3 and XUnit2
The path of the project file containing the feature files.

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Tools.SpecFlow.SpecFlowAliases.SpecFlowTestExecutionReport(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,System.Action{Cake.Core.ICakeContext},Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Tools.SpecFlow.TestExecutionReport.SpecFlowTestExecutionReportSettings)
member.summary: Creates a formatted HTML report of a test execution. The report contains a summary about the executed tests and the result and also a detailed report for the individual scenario executions. See SpecFlow Documentation for more information.
member.param: The action to run SpecFlow for. Supported actions are: MSTest, NUNit, NUNit3, XUnit and XUnit2
The path of the project file containing the feature files.

summary.para: Contains functionality related to TextTransform.

#tool "nuget:?package=Mono.TextTransform"

member.summary: Gets or sets the settings filename to be used to control additional settings such as data collectors.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.Parallel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tests are executed in parallel. By default up to all available cores on the machine may be used. The number of cores to use may be configured using a settings file.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.EnableCodeCoverage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable data diagnostic adapter 'CodeCoverage' in the test run. Default settings are used if not specified using settings file.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.InIsolation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to run tests within the vstest.console.exe process. This makes vstest.console.exe process less likely to be stopped on an error in the tests, but tests might run slower. Defaults to false.
member.value: true if running in isolation; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.UseVsixExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value overriding whether VSTest will use or skip the VSIX extensions installed (if any) in the test run.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.TestAdapterPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that makes VSTest use custom test adapters from a given path (if any) in the test run.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.PlatformArchitecture
member.summary: Gets or sets the target platform architecture to be used for test execution.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.FrameworkVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the target .NET Framework version to be used for test execution.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.TestCaseFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets an expression to run only tests that match, of the format <property>Operator<value>[|&<Expression>] where Operator is one of =, != or ~ (Operator ~ has 'contains' semantics and is applicable for string properties like DisplayName). Parenthesis () can be used to group sub-expressions. Examples: Priority=1 (FullyQualifiedName~Nightly|Name=MyTestMethod)

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.Diag
member.summary: Gets or sets a path which makes VSTest write diagnosis trace logs to specified file.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Tools.VSTest.VSTestSettings.Logger
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of your logger. Possible values: - A blank string (or null): no logger - "trx": Visual Studio's built-in logger - "AppVeyor": AppVeyor's custom logger which is available only when building your solution on the AppVeyor platform - any custom value: the name of your custom logger

member.summary: The XmlReader will throw an exception when it finds a 'DOCTYPE' markup.

Additional settings to tweak Xml Peek behavior.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <pastery xmlns = "http://cakebuild.net/pastery" > < cake price="1.62" /> </pastery>

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlPokeAliases

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlPokeAliases.XmlPoke(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the value of, or remove, target nodes.
member.param: The xpath of the nodes to set.
The value to set too. Leave blank to remove the selected nodes.

example.para: Change the server setting in the configuration from testhost.somecompany.com to productionhost.somecompany.com.
example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="server" value="testhost.somecompany.com" /> </appSettings> </configuration>

example.para: Modify the noNamespaceSchemaLocation in an XML file.
example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <Commands xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="Path Value"> </Commands>

example.para: Remove an app setting from a config file.
example.code: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="server" value="testhost.somecompany.com" /> <add key="testing" value="true" /> </appSettings> </configuration>

example.para: Credit to NAnt for the original example. http://nant.sourceforge.net/release/latest/help/tasks/xmlpoke.html

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationAlias.XmlTransform(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath)
member.summary: Performs XML XSL transformation
member.param: Transformation result path, will overwrite if exists.

example.code:
This example code will convert the Cake nuspec into html using the XmlTransform alias. XML stylesheet: <xsl:for-each select="package/p:metadata"> <xsl:value-of select="p:id"/> </xsl:for-each>

Description

Files

    •
XmlTransform("./nuspec.xsl", "./nuspec/Cake.nuspec", "./Cake.htm");

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationAlias.XmlTransform(Cake.Core.ICakeContext,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Core.IO.FilePath,Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings)
member.summary: Performs XML XSL transformation
member.param: Optional settings for result file xml writer

example.code:
This example code will convert the Cake nuspec into html using the XmlTransform alias, specifying that result should be indented and using Unicode encoding. XML stylesheet: <xsl:for-each select="package/p:metadata"> <xsl:value-of select="p:id"/> </xsl:for-each>

Description

Files

    •
XmlTransform("./nuspec.xsl", "./nuspec/Cake.nuspec", "./Cake.htm", new XmlTransformationSettings { Indent = true, Encoding = Encoding.Unicode});

member.name: T:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.Overwrite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether overwriting existing file is permitted

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.CheckCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the XML writer should check to ensure that all characters in the document conform to the "2.2 Characters" section of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.ConformanceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating level of conformance that the XmlWriter checks the XML output for.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.DoNotEscapeUriAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the XmlWriter does not escape URI attributes.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of text encoding to use.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to indent elements.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.IndentChars
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string to use when indenting. This setting is used when the Indent property is set to true.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.NamespaceHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the XmlWriter should remove duplicate namespace declarations when writing XML content. The default behavior is for the writer to output all namespace declarations that are present in the writer's namespace resolver.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.NewLineChars
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string to use for line breaks.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.NewLineHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to normalize line breaks in the output.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.NewLineOnAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to write attributes on a new line.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.OmitXmlDeclaration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to omit an XML declaration.

member.name: P:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.WriteEndDocumentOnClose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the XmlWriter will add closing tags to all unclosed element tags when the Close method is called

member.name: M:Cake.Common.Xml.XmlTransformationSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
